summary:
Tech Principal Consultant at Thoughtworks, with a 13-year track record in different business contexts. I had played various roles such as: developer, technical leader, architect and strategic advisor for Technological Initiatives. I consider myself a technical generalist with a strong learner strength which enables me to switch contexts and get a deeper understanding of specific technical aspects based on prioritized needs.

I am passionate about consulting at the strategy level, and being an active part in building the vision of teams that enable strategic initiatives. I am interested in topics related to security, cloud architecture, and technology platforms such as: OAuth and OpenId Connect protocols, API Management, APIOps, Service Mesh, cloud native and event oriented architectures.

I enjoy blending technology with business, including purpose alignment of technology initiatives to fulfill business strategic objectives, communicating technical details of architecture solutions at different levels of detail, and working closely with business roles to connect technology decisions with business needs and priorities.

certifications.name: Distributed Data Patterns for microservices course

profile_positions.description: Similarly to previous executions of the role as a Technical Principal, the nature of my work was analyzing and providing technical context in new opportunities, bringing strategic thinking considering the context of my client needs to align on expectations and risks. Also provide my opinions and discuss ideas with technical stakeholders to make decisions, looking for win-win alternatives. profile_positions.title: Technical Principal

profile_positions.description:
As a Tech Talent Adviser I worked in a cross-functional team (with XD, product, technical, data & change management roles with previous experience).  With my team,  we created a tech talent framework focusing on a group of job families prioritized.

This talent framework, to be extended to additional families in the future, was composed by a capability model (capabilities and related competences with levels of proficiency expected per grade and role), career paths with grades and roles transitions, role accountabilities, and change management/adoption framework to implement the talent framework on different job families in the organization incrementally.  Additionally we provided a change management detailed plan and a high level roadmap to execute the recommended actions.

We established a method of incremental co-creation, were we worked with people from the organization we worked with on a day to day basis, first refining our proposal with an small core team that included our main sponsor to validate alignment and capture feedback, then as the next iteration, bringing the refined proposal to a larger group of focals that represented the different job families to capture more feedback. And finally, once we had all the parts, we ran some cross checks to validate consistency through all the models and we made the final improvements. 

As a Technical Talent Advisor my main focus was facilitating this co-creation for the technical roles job families prioritized (i.e: software engineer, reliability engineer, engineer manager roles) and providing options for decision making.
profile_positions.title: Tech Talent Adviser - Talent Strategy Advisory

profile_positions.description:
As a Business Architect & Tech Adviser I worked in a cross-functional team (user experience, product and technical roles) assessing the operating model and talent management of an organization's business unit to recommend a transformation roadmap.

With my team, we interviewed key stakeholders of the organization business unit we were assessing, to identify the current operating model and governance in place. Additionally, through the creation of a service blueprint, we identified the pain points of interactions of the business unit assessed with other areas in the organization.

During the assessment phase, the architecture function got relevance, in concordance, I needed to deep dive in the roles definitions for Tech Lead, Solution Architect and Enterprise Architect, their interactions and responsibilities; as well as establishing and improving an Architecture Review Board process, with a cadence for collaboration and alignment with the organization's global architecture leaders.

With my team, we co-create with our stakeholders a roadmap for transforming the business unit to a more efficient and service oriented organization with a higher level of expertise, through the usage of a service catalog, we proposed an evolution of the service lines distribution, refining the most critical services generating a common taxonomy in the organization and establishing feedback loops with the consumers of the services. Additionally, we recommended kicking off the change management plan for the Architecture service line ‘thin slice’ by for example identifying the Architecture Center of Excellence members and potential change makers and establishing a cadence for Change Champions Network meetings and activities. Finally, as part of the change management plan, we invited Mark Richard and Neal Ford to give a guided group of Enterprise Architecture workshops as role enablement of Enterprise Architects to execute their function.
profile_positions.title: Business Architect & Technical Adviser - Org. Design Advisory

Also provide my opinions and discuss ideas with technical stakeholders to make decisions, looking for win-win alternatives.  And support teams to align technical details of the solutions by motivating and cultivating technical leaders.
profile_positions.title: Technical Principal

profile_positions.description: As a Technical Analyst I participated in my client’s strategy execution governance process activities to identify improvements. Working closely with Transformation experts I provided my pragmatic point of view to make recommendations to the client in relation to governance cadence, portfolio segmentation based on the types of MoS, balance of objectives distribution, tooling and process for execution. Based on my previous experience as Tech Lead in  value driven oriented agile teams, I focused also on recommendations around value driven prioritization, backlog categorization to predict capacity allocation, incubation and promotion of innovation candidates to the strategy.
profile_positions.title: Technical Analyst - Value Driven Portfolio Advisory

profile_positions.description: As a Technical Principal, the nature of my work was analyzing and providing technical context in new opportunities, bringing strategic thinking considering the context of my client needs to align on expectations and risks.  My role also gave me opportunities to provide my opinions and discuss ideas with technical stakeholders to make decisions, looking for win-win alternatives.  Additionally, I provided opinions to align technical details of the solutions in teams by motivating and cultivating technical leaders. For example, based on my personal interests and knowledge on event oriented architectures and domain driven oriented solutions, I use to provide guidance on clean architecture, DDD techniques like context mapping or event storming, sagas alternatives, circuit breaker options and architecture evolution patterns.
profile_positions.title: Technical Principal

profile_positions.description: As a Technical Lead, I worked in a cross-functional team (user experience, product and technical roles) focusing on assessing our client's status to provide actionable recommendations.  Beginning from our client’s vision and expectations for the future, taking a deep dive on multiple aspects like: mindset, processes, technology and trends, my main responsibility was to analyze architecture, delivery infrastructure, API and Mobile aspects to provide recommendations about modernization strategy, tech architecture, digital platform, team structure, and mobile app development, based on a value driven prioritization from customer journey analysis.
profile_positions.title: Technical Lead - Mobile Platform Advisory

profile_positions.description:
Given my client's needs I played Product Architect and Technical Lead roles for specific business domains like Notifications and Customer Identity and Access Management. 

As a Product Architect I worked defining the solution architecture identifying an initial set of microservices and integrations with the GCP products (container level referring to the C4 model). Then, knowing the business specific needs and technical solution proposed, I worked generating an initial backlog of stories to reflect the agreed scope.

As a Technical Lead I focused on the product architecture implementation alignment including the microservices internal architecture and integration configurations (component level referring to C4 model).  The solution stack included NodeJS, Fastify, Helm, Typescript, Go/Axios, Knex.  Some cross functional requirements I needed to focus on were logging and tracing in a distributed ecosystem using Istio, domain oriented clean architecture implementation, scalability of the solution in scenarios of high load, error handling and circuit breaker, integration with pub/sub and alignment with messaging standards.

Looking for the best interests of my client, and given my previous knowledge of Authorization protocols and integration with CIAM solutions, l played an Advisory role for an external team focused in the integration with a CIAM solution, bringing visibility of risks and trade offs of different approaches the team was proposing based on my previous experience. Advisory work nature required alignment with multiple stakeholders and communication of the technical complexity in order to reflect additional work needed in the teams backlogs.

Additionally, there was an important time zone difference between the members of the team that required good sync and async communication to enable the daily workflow with a minimum overlapping.
profile_positions.title: Technical Lead, Product Architect and Advisor - Retail Platform

profile_positions.description:
Given that my client was facing an On Premise to Cloud migration, I focused in Google Cloud Platform (specially GKE) and API management technical skills. Also supported Domain Driven Design needs for the API modeling like facilitating event storming activities (to identify business contexts) and advising architectural design decisions like following a hexagonal (ports and adapter) architecture and using architecture decision records. I also advised about the API authorization service to service communication in GCP. 

This work required reviewing different topologies like service mesh combined with centralized API Gateway, and evaluating potential authorization/authentication solutions, followed by more in depth technical sessions with security architects and technical representatives of candidates.  Additionally, I also supported the API Management (API Portal and API Gateway) integration decisions and gave advice about the developer experience supported by the API Management tooling automation in the API development path to production.

As an Advisor part of my daily basis was related to work closely with architects from different business areas recommending and aligning processes, tooling and ways of working to govern the API development.
profile_positions.title: API Strategy Technical Lead and Advisor

profile_positions.description:
I was relocated to Santiago to work at my current client’s office as a technical advisor, giving support to the Digital business unit of the company on their technical decisions and initiatives. I worked leading the API strategy team and advising my client about aSecure Delivery Lifecycle adoption plan. During this period of time I focused in client-facing and C-level communication skills working close to my technical and business stakeholders. I facedstakeholders’ changes, in consequence I needed to build new relationships and communicate toother lines of leadership in the company. I experienced a big core system’s migration (that involved many areas of the company) and supported technical assessments to evaluate Continuous Delivery and API Management maturity.

As a technical advisor, I became the focal point for ThoughtWorks’ teams to filter and communicate to my client the security risks identified, connecting to our security subject matter experts located at other offices like UK or US and giving support to team members to follow the Incidents Response Plan. I supported the coordination between ThoughtWorks’ Infosec and TechOps areas with my client’s Cybersecurity areas to configure the VPN site to site. I was able to prioritize security awareness internal trainings and (with the involvement of more people) was able to support people growth to become a distributed core team (between Chile and Brazil) of security trainers for scaling the initiative future phases.
profile_positions.title: Technical Principal

profile_positions.description:
As a consultant developer at ThoughtWorks I had worked in a variety of projects from both a technology and business context viewpoint. For this period of time I have successfully played the technical lead role in agile teams facilitating making technical decisions and supporting technical advisor and consultancy.  

I worked as technical leader for an authorization/authenticationsolution based on Open Id Connect protocol. I worked as technical leader and developer with US clients,understanding their business process, and proposing incremental solutions to their daily problems inrelation to their systems by promoting good agile practices and delivering quality software according totheir needs.

I had been exposed to languages like C#, Python, Java, Ruby, Terraform and tools like: Celery, RabbitMQ, Elastic Search, Jenkins, GCP, GKE and techniques like: TDD, pair programming, DDD, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
profile_positions.title: Lead Consultant Developer
